    About

    I enjoy work that is . . .

    Technical

    Creative

    Strategic

    Team-Oriented

    I came to web development from a career in market research consulting, which included the UX research that initially sparked my interest in code. From my previous work, I bring with me extensive experience in project management and team collaboration, an eye for usability, and a sensitivity toward broader business objectives.

    To accelerate my learning in programming, I recently attended the Recurse Center, a three-month self-directed retreat in New York City which brings programmers together for collaboration, pair programming, technical talks, and social events.

    Projects

    TimeTiles

    Try it
    Email: test@email.com
    Password: tiles

    Front End

    API

    JavaScript, React, Redux, Node, MongoDB

    When I started learning to code, I quickly realized that the "use it or lose it" nature of learning meant a linear, to-do list approach wouldn't be effective.

    I created TimeTiles as a way to log your activities and time spent toward different goals, and then view at a glance what you've been up to. Tiles lighten or darken in color according to how recently you've worked toward a goal and the total time you've spent.

    This project was an opportunity to develop skills in:

    • Managing app state with Redux
    • Creating a RESTful API with Node and Express
    • Client-side routing with React Router v4
    • Server-side authenticaion with JSON Web Tokens (JWT), Passport, and bcrypt
    • Writing maintainable CSS with SCSS partials and component-based stylesheets

    Stay tuned! I'll be adding more projects soon.

    The code for this site can be found here.
